message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the characterization of the throughput of a broadcast network using rateless codes, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT). The network is assumed to be a Markov modulated erasure channel, which is a type of network commonly studied in the field of network information theory (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the behavior of the system throughput as a function of the coding block size and the number of users, which is a topic related to performance analysis and optimization of communication networks (cs.SI). The use of simulations to validate the theoretical results suggests that the paper may also belong to the category of computer science and computational physics (cs.DS) or computational complexity (cs.CC).
